description: a(n) = sum_{d|n, d=1 mod 4} d^3 - sum_{d|n, d=3 mod 4} d^3.
comments: Multiplicative because it is the Inverse MÃ¶bius transform of [1 0 -3^3 0 5^3 0 -7^3 ...], which is multiplicative. - _Christian G. Bower_, May 18 2005
maple: A050459 := proc(n) local a; a := 0 ; for d in numtheory[divisors](n) do if d mod 4 = 1 then a := a+d^3 ; elif d mod 4 = 3 then a := a-d^3 ; end if; end do;  a ; end proc:seq(A050459(n),n=1..100) ; # _R. J. Mathar_, Jan 07 2011
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 23 1999
